data.name: Sparse array implode function
data.description:
A sparse array in JavaScript is an array with 'missing' elements. In this kata you're required to create a new array method that flattens the input array and removes all its empty, i.e. uninitialized, elements. This method should modify the original array in place and then return it. An input array itself may contain sparse arrays as its elements. These elements should be 'imploded' and flattened as well.

For example, `[,1,,2,,[3,,4,[,5,,6]],,7,].implode()` should return `[1,2,3,4,5,6,7]`.

Related kata:  
[Sparse array this is?](http://www.codewars.com/kata/sparse-array-this-is/)  
[Sparse array split function](http://www.codewars.com/kata/sparse-array-split-function/)
